content:
• Thursday, June 7, 2012
  • ATPAQ

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) announces that CEO Matt McCarroll resigned and has been replaced by T....

    ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG) announces that CEO Matt McCarroll resigned and has been replaced by T. Paul Bulmahn. Mr. Bulmahn will continue to serve as Chairman and also in the newly created position of Executive Chairman. Shares -8.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:29 PM | 4 Comments
  • IGT

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT) receives a unanimous recommendation from the Nevada...

    International Game Technology (NYSE:IGT) receives a unanimous recommendation from the Nevada Gaming Control Board for an interactive online gaming service provider and manufacturer license. Nevada is the first U.S. state to adopt statutes to allow online gaming. Shares +3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:15 PM
  • MOH

    Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH) says the Ohio Department of Job and Family Services has upheld the...

    Molina Healthcare (NYSE:MOH) says the Ohio Department of Job and Family Services has upheld the protest filing of its Ohio health plan and recommended it be awarded a Medicaid managed care provider agreement for the entire state. Shares +20% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:08 PM
  • FLT

    FleetCor (NYSE:FLT) files a 6.75M share secondary offering. Citigroup will act as sole...

    FleetCor (NYSE:FLT) files a 6.75M share secondary offering. Citigroup will act as sole underwriter for the offering. Shares -3.3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • CHTP

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) says all corporate officers and members of its Board of...

    Chelsea Therapeutics (NASDAQ:CHTP) says all corporate officers and members of its Board of Directors volunteered to receive a 25% reduction in compensation until data from its ongoing Phase III study of Northera is available. In addition, at least 35% of Chelsea's non-executive staff are expected to temporarily transition to part-time status and performance bonuses for all employees, including officers, will be suspended for 2012 or until Northera is granted marketing approval in the U.S. Shares +7.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • CMTL

    Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL): FQ3 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $99.8M...

    Comtech Telecommunications (NASDAQ:CMTL): FQ3 EPS of $0.29 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $99.8M (-24% Y/Y) beats by $2M. Shares +3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • FRAN

    More on Francesca Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q1 beats across board on a big jump in sales. Net...

    More on Francesca Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q1 beats across board on a big jump in sales. Net sales jumped 48.6% to $61M from $41M Y/Y, with comp boutique sales increasing by 15.5%. Gross margin rose to 53.1% compared to 52.4% in the same prior year period, primarily as a result of leveraging occupancy costs. Shares +9.8% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • FRAN

    Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q1 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $61.3M (+48.6%...

    Francesca's Holdings (NASDAQ:FRAN): Q1 EPS of $0.20 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $61.3M (+48.6% Y/Y) beats by $1M. Shares +8% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • COO

    Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ2 EPS of $1.12 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $344.6M (+6% Y/Y)...

    Cooper Companies (NYSE:COO): FQ2 EPS of $1.12 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $344.6M (+6% Y/Y) misses by $6M. Shares -5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • BA

    Boeing (BA +1.4%) and Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY +4.3%) are battling it out over El Al Israel Airlines....

    Boeing (BA +1.4%) and Airbus (OTCPK:EADSY +4.3%) are battling it out over El Al Israel Airlines. El Al is looking to order between 15 and 20 widebody jets over the next decade. BA is already providing the carrier with a $40M loan contingent on it committing to buy or lease new 787 Dreamliners by the end of the year, but Airbus has countered, offering to repay the loan if El Al switches allegiance and buys it's planes for the first time.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 2 Comments
  • QRVO

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD +2.5%) is raised to Buy from Neutral at Davenport, which says strong...

    RF Micro Devices (RFMD +2.5%) is raised to Buy from Neutral at Davenport, which says strong demand for the chip maker's products leave it with the potential to meet or exceed Wall Street expectations in coming months. Noting RFMD is a top supplier to smartphone manufacturers, the firm expects it to remain the lead supplier this year for Samsung.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:59 PM
  • VIVHY

    Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY +2%) reportedly is considering reorganization options, including the...

    Vivendi (OTCPK:VIVHY +2%) reportedly is considering reorganization options, including the potential sale of all or part of its 61% stake in videogame publisher Activision (ATVI -2.5%). Unclear is what Vivendi might do with any proceeds from selling the ATVI stake, who might be interested in buying it, or whether a such move would lead to an acquisition of the company in whole.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 2 Comments
  • PSX

    Phillips 66 (PSX +2%) deserves a higher P/E multiple than the paltry ratio refiners are getting...

    Phillips 66 (PSX +2%) deserves a higher P/E multiple than the paltry ratio refiners are getting now, CEO Greg Garland tells Barron's. PSX has gathered ~60% of its profits on average in the past three years from higher-return businesses, principally chemicals and midstream assets which he says generate 20%-plus returns on capital and offer significant reinvestment opportunities.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • MDR

    McDermott (MDR +11%) shares march higher following a batch of insider buying after dropping 44%...

    McDermott (MDR +11%) shares march higher following a batch of insider buying after dropping 44% Y/Y. Insiders may be seeing progress toward beefing up the company's backlog - now below $1B for 2013 - but Paul Ausick says that’s a risky bet: If oil prices fall much further, production costs can eat up a lot of profits, meaning "less cash flow and less capital investment."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 2 Comments
  • STEI

    Stewart Enterprises (STEI +8%) gets a big pop after its FQ2 earnings beat Street estimates late...

    Stewart Enterprises (STEI +8%) gets a big pop after its FQ2 earnings beat Street estimates late yesterday on a jump in gross margins. Net profit actually slid 13% Y/Y however as the funeral-services company's results were hurt by higher taxes and restructuring costs.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM
  • BNNY

    Shares of Annie's (BNNY -6.4%) slump after posting its first quarterly report as a public...

    Shares of Annie's (BNNY -6.4%) slump after posting its first quarterly report as a public company. Despite beating the estimates of analysts and issuing rosy guidance for FY12, investors seem to be selling off with an eye on the stock's stretched valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • TAT

    TransAtlantic Petroleum (TAT +6.7%) says Turkey's government has approved the divestiture of its...

    TransAtlantic Petroleum (TAT +6.7%) says Turkey's government has approved the divestiture of its oilfield services business to Dalea Partners and Abraaj Investment Management. TAT plans to use the cash proceeds of the sale to reduce debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 3 Comments
  • PSX

    Phillips 66 (PSX +2.3%) may be changing its mind about selling its 247K bbl/day refinery in...

    Phillips 66 (PSX +2.3%) may be changing its mind about selling its 247K bbl/day refinery in Belle Chasse, La., apparently seeing few potential buyers as U.S. gasoline consumption falls and lower crude prices make refining more attractive. PSX may believe it can find an export market by the end of summer for its refined products that would make the refinery worth keeping.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • JNPR

    Shares of Juniper Networks (JNPR -4.1%) trade lower following a hard-hitting downgrade from...

    Shares of Juniper Networks (JNPR -4.1%) trade lower following a hard-hitting downgrade from Needham's Alex Henderson. The crux of the analyst's argument is that Juniper's current and planned product lines won't change margin erosion or a moderating growth path.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:06 PM
  • YELP

    Foursquare rolls out a completely redesigned app that gives users more relevant real-time data...

    Foursquare rolls out a completely redesigned app that gives users more relevant real-time data that borders on the types of recommendations and review offered up by Yelp. It's the kind of news that the vocal (NYSE:YELP) shorts may have been looking for, but shares aren't cooperating for them and have roared to a 6.7% gain.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:01 PM
  • PCYC

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +10.2%) continues its climb again today on the back of the FDA's orphan...

    Pharmacyclics (PCYC +10.2%) continues its climb again today on the back of the FDA's orphan status approval of its chronic lymphocyctic leukemia treatment. Analysts are projecting blockbuster sales for the cancer drug, including Brean Murray, who initiated the shares with a Buy earlier today on the back of the announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:50 PM
  • CMI

    Cummins' (CMI +2.5%) power generation unit says its entire stationary diesel generator set range...

    Cummins' (CMI +2.5%) power generation unit says its entire stationary diesel generator set range from 680-2750 kw will be ready to meet stringent EPA regulations for the North American market. CMI will begin shipment of Tier 4 interim certified generator sets beginning in Q3.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • GOLD

    Investors who have enjoyed the sanctuary of gold mining stocks (GDX -3.7%) recently are feeling...

    Investors who have enjoyed the sanctuary of gold mining stocks (GDX -3.7%) recently are feeling the pain today, after Bernanke's testimony failed to deliver on hopes for QE3: ABX -4.7%, GG -3.2%, NEM -2.2%, AU -3.4%, GFI -3%, KGC -7%, AUY -2.4%, AEM -3.2%, IAG -4.1%, NGD -3.5%. (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 3 Comments
  • BBY

    What's he up to? A report from a Minnesota newspaper raises the possbility that Richard Schulze...

    What's he up to? A report from a Minnesota newspaper raises the possbility that Richard Schulze wants to take Best Buy (BBY -4.6%) private - instead of selling off his 20% stake. To accomplish the mission, he will need to raise close to $12B. Shares of BBY are paring earlier losses.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM | 4 Comments
  • ACHN

    Baird says the weakness in Achillion (ACHN -4.5%) is a buying opportunity , following the...

    Baird says the weakness in Achillion (ACHN -4.5%) is a buying opportunity , following the announcement of the resignation of its Chief Medical Officer. The firm notes that ACHN is in a "catalyst rich period" with a solid pipeline, and is confident the chief Scientific Officer will be able to assume the CMO's duties without any significant disruption.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • GMCR

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) start to perk up, now down only 0.3%, as...

    Shares of Green Mountain Coffee Roasters (NASDAQ:GMCR) start to perk up, now down only 0.3%, as rumors that Starbucks might be selling K-Cups out of select stores on Monday filters out. You have to excuse the confusion of investors, only yesterday GMCR's CEO said the in-store launch would be in the fall.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • RUE

    Stocks of specialty retailers are getting hit up and down the sector after Lululemon's slashed...

    Stocks of specialty retailers are getting hit up and down the sector after Lululemon's slashed guidance and Men's Wearhouse lackluster Q1 casts a dark shadow. Decliners: RUE -2.2%, BKE -4.4%, ARO -2.8%, AEO -2.5%, PSUN -3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • CGG-OLD

    CGGVeritas (CGV +3.8%) signs an MOU with Saudi Aramco for collaborative research and development...

    CGGVeritas (CGV +3.8%) signs an MOU with Saudi Aramco for collaborative research and development of geophysical acquisition, processing, analysis and interpretation technologies. CGV also will begin acquiring a fourth repeat survey on the North Sea Ekofisk field as part of a program for which it was awarded seismic data acquisition and processing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM
  • AKS

    Seeking Alpha contributor Qineqt weighs in on the steel sector today, saying that manufacturers...

    Seeking Alpha contributor Qineqt weighs in on the steel sector today, saying that manufacturers with exposure to industries where the end demand is still growing present a buying opportunity due to their competitive advantage, margin expansion potential and cheap valuations. Recommended: AK Steel (AKS +1%), Nucor (NUE +1%), Steel Dynamics (STLD +1.8%).

     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM

  • Rising to $1,630/oz. following the PBOC ease, gold gives it all up and more - off 1.8% to $1,605...

    Rising to $1,630/oz. following the PBOC ease, gold gives it all up and more - off 1.8% to $1,605 - as Bernanke is less dovish than hoped. Silver -2.5% to $28.79.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 4 Comments
  • PHM

    Homebuilder stocks are getting a lift today from record low mortgage rates, with the 30-year...

    Homebuilder stocks are getting a lift today from record low mortgage rates, with the 30-year fixed-rate dropping to 3.67% and the 15-year fixed rate declining to 2.94%. Last year at this time, the 30-year mortgage averaged 4.49% and the 15-year averaged 3.68%: (XHB +1%), (PHM +2.4%), (LEN +0.8%), (DHI +1%), TOL -6.1%, (KBH +1.4%).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • BBY

    Despite some angst-provoking headlines on Best Buy (BBY -6.5%), Stifel Nicolaus is out with a...

    Despite some angst-provoking headlines on Best Buy (BBY -6.5%), Stifel Nicolaus is out with a defense, saying that the accelerated resignation of its chairman is a positive. Stifel not withstanding, trader sentiment is tipping toward letting the dust settle on the move before jumping on BBY shares.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM
  • BTU

    Reports that China has approved new steel projects, a move that could boost steel prices, sends...

    Reports that China has approved new steel projects, a move that could boost steel prices, sends Peabody Energy (BTU +4.1%) to the top of the S&P leader board; BTU sells coal for making steel to Asia markets. Shares of fellow coal miners also surge: ANR +3.1%, PCX +4.6%, ACI +1.8%, CLD +1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:35 AM | 4 Comments
  • TPX

    Shares of Tempur-Pedic (TPX -4.6%) haven't found a bottom yet, even though mattress peers are...

    Shares of Tempur-Pedic (TPX -4.6%) haven't found a bottom yet, even though mattress peers are moving higher: ZZ +2.5%, SCSS +2.4%, MFRM +3.6%. Analysts aren't done taking their ratings down on TPX with Piper the latest to move off its bullish call.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 5 Comments
  • NAV

    Shares of Navistar International (NYSE:NAV) lop off 24.5% after the company delivers...

    Shares of Navistar International (NYSE:NAV) lop off 24.5% after the company delivers disappointing FQ2 results and reshuffles management. Warranty cost reduced profits by a whopping $104M during the period.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM | 1 Comment
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -7.1%) says Hatim Tyabji will be its new chairman effectively immediately after...

    Best Buy (BBY -7.1%) says Hatim Tyabji will be its new chairman effectively immediately after founder Richard Schulze stepped back. While the acceleration of Schulze's departure raises a few eyebrows, his 20% stake in the firm that might be up for sale now could be an even more alarming event for investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • CMVT

    More on Comverse Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:CMVT) Q1: CTI shares -5.8% following its...

    More on Comverse Technology Inc. (NASDAQ:CMVT) Q1: CTI shares -5.8% following its across-the-board miss, although net losses did narrow slightly to $53.2M from $59.2M. One bright spot was growth in CTI's BSS customer solution orders. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • RIO

    Rio Tinto (RIO +6.2%) shoots higher after releasing data on strong demand for its ores. A top...

    Rio Tinto (RIO +6.2%) shoots higher after releasing data on strong demand for its ores. A top exec says RIO expects to account for more than 25% of additional global iron ore output over the next seven years, with supply needs growing at a rate of at least 100M metric tons per year in order to meet demand for the steelmaking raw ingredient.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:38 AM
  • BBY

    Best Buy (BBY -4.1%) founder and Chairman Richard Schulze is exploring his options for his 20.1%...

    Best Buy (BBY -4.1%) founder and Chairman Richard Schulze is exploring his options for his 20.1% stake in the retailer as he resigns a couple of weeks early. Schulze's departure, including as a director - he had planned to stay in that role until 2013 - follows his failure to tell the board's audit committee about allegations against ex-CEO Brian Dunn. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:34 AM
  • INVE

    Identive Group (NASDAQ:INVE) +9.5% premarket after announcing it is providing 266K smart card...

    Identive Group (NASDAQ:INVE) +9.5% premarket after announcing it is providing 266K smart card readers to an unnamed U.S. government agency for secure authentication and email encryption. "For this agency, the product delivery schedule was quite aggressive, and Identive was the only supplier capable of delivering the required volumes in a short time," the company says.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM
  • MDR

    McDermott (NYSE:MDR) +2.9% premarket on news of large insider buying at the engineering company...

    McDermott (NYSE:MDR) +2.9% premarket on news of large insider buying at the engineering company for oil and gas projects. CEO Stephen Johnson disclosed buying 102,368 shares on June 6 at an average price of $9.64; four executives bought a total of 175K shares worth ~$2.6M.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM

  • Market preview: European and U.S. equity securities are all green following the PBOC's rate cuts...

    Market preview: European and U.S. equity securities are all green following the PBOC's rate cuts and other easing measures, which sent oil higher also. The S&P Benchmark is +0.75%. Now the focus shifts to Ben Bernanke, who's due to appear in Congress today, to see if he'll add to the easing signals sent out yesterday by three Fed officials. Later: Quarterly Services Report, Consumer Credit, Fed speak
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • RCL

    Nomura raises Q2 profit estimates for Royal Carribean (NYSE:RCL) and Carnival (NYSE:CCL) with...

    Nomura raises Q2 profit estimates for Royal Carribean (NYSE:RCL) and Carnival (NYSE:CCL) with lower fuel prices on the horizon. Analyst Harry Curtis also moves to a more positive outlook for long-term pricing, with the fallout from the Costa Concordia sinking diminishing after Q3. Premarket: CCL +1.5%, RCL +1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM
  • XNPT

    The FDA OKs XenoPort's (XNPT -3.6%) and GSK's Horizant drug to treat post-herpetic neuralgia, or...

    The FDA OKs XenoPort's (XNPT -3.6%) and GSK's Horizant drug to treat post-herpetic neuralgia, or nerve pain related to shingles, which affects around 100K people a year in the U.S. GSK will pay XenoPort a $10M milestone payment following the first sales of the treatment. XenoPort is already approved for restless legs syndrome.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • DGIT

    Premarket gainers: DGIT +5%. DANG +5%. RIO +5%. Losers: MOH -25%. MW -19%. NAV -16%. CMVT -10%....

    Premarket gainers: DGIT +5%. DANG +5%. RIO +5%.
    Losers: MOH -25%. MW -19%. NAV -16%. CMVT -10%. PLL-OLD -8%. LULU -8%. ABR -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • RF

    Regions Financial (NYSE:RF) +2.4% premarket after receiving an upgrade to Outperform from...

    Regions Financial (NYSE:RF) +2.4% premarket after receiving an upgrade to Outperform from Macquarie. Standard stuff: In a time of global financial jitters, stick with domestically-focused regional banks.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • TITN

    More on Titan (NASDAQ:TITN) Q1: net profit at the farm equipment retailer edges up to $7.5M from...

    More on Titan (NASDAQ:TITN) Q1: net profit at the farm equipment retailer edges up to $7.5M from $7.2M, while costs jump 39%. Agricultural revenue +26%. Maintains FY 2013 outlook for EPS of $2.55-$2.75 on revenue of $1.95B-$2.1B. Shares have risen 24% in the last three months but are -6.9% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • GNVC

    GenVec (NASDAQ:GNVC) surging 19% after the USDA's Animal & Plant Health Inspection Service...

    GenVec (NASDAQ:GNVC) surging 19% after the USDA's Animal & Plant Health Inspection Service grants a conditional license for GenVec's vaccine for foot-and-mouth disease for use in cattle. GenVec also licenses the rights to develop and commercialize the technology to Sanofi's (NASDAQ:SNY) Merial unit. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:33 AM | 2 Comments
  • LULU

    More on Lululemon's (NASDAQ:LULU) FQ1: Comparable-store sales rose 25% Y/Y. Direct to consumer...

    More on Lululemon's (NASDAQ:LULU) FQ1: Comparable-store sales rose 25% Y/Y. Direct to consumer revenue increased 179% to $38.4M. SG&A expenses as a percentage of revenue fell to 29.4%, from 31% a year ago. Sees Q2 EPS of $0.28-$0.30 vs. $0.33 and FY12 EPS of $1.55-$1.60 vs. $1.63 consensus. Shares -13.1% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:26 AM | 1 Comment
